The colon is about 1 to two meters in length and is subdivided into Ascending Colon, Transverse Colon and the Descending colon. What is the function of the Colon? Most of the digestion and absorption happens in the stomach and little intestines. That is the purpose why when the food reaches the colon, it is fundamentally composed of water and waste. Consequently the primary function of the colon is for moving the waste for removal and also to reabsorb some excess water. The fecal matter starts out soft and watery in the ascending portion, it begins to harden slightly when it reaches the transverse portion and after additional re-absorption of water, it is then extruded from the physique by defecating.
